This Summer Film Festival in New York City will continue to introduce independent films, putting Brooklyn on the map as a cinematic center.

What's Happening at the Annual Summer Festival in Brooklyn?

This year's Brooklyn Film Festival (BFF) features 130 film premiers at seven unique venues where you can immerse yourself in Brooklyn's unique culture. This year's theme, dubbed "THRESHOLD," highlights the festivals coming of age and the amazing art that emerges from challenging times in history.

This film festival in New York City has something for movie lovers of all ages to enjoy. The BFF has an entire festival devoted to films from young filmmakers. The Kid's Film Festival on Saturday June 2nd includes animated shorts, documentaries, and live-action features – all rated "G."

Patrons can also take part in special events for networking with filmmakers and others in the industry. Don't miss the Award Ceremony and Closing Night Party on Sunday June 10th.

Plan Your Trip to the Brooklyn Film Festival in New York City

The Brooklyn Film Festival runs every day from Friday, June 1st through Sunday June 10th. Weekday events start at 6:00 or 6:30 PM, while Saturday and Sunday events start earlier in the afternoon at 2:00 PM or 2:30 PM.

Main venues include Windmill Studios NYC and Wythe Hotel Cinema with screenings at an additional five smaller venues.

If you're planning a trip to NYC for the BFF or any summer festival in Brooklyn, consider staying with us at The Manhattan Club. We're a residential style boutique hotel in the heart of New York City with luxurious accommodations.
